short: Extra CSS selector for hints mode
description: An extra CSS selector to match additional HTML elements that should be treated as clickable/focusable in hints mode. This is useful for web applications that use custom components or non-standard HTML elements that Surfingkeys doesn't recognize by default.
valueDescription: A valid CSS selector string, or empty string to disable custom selectors

values.description: Default value; no custom selectors are applied, only built-in clickable elements are recognized
Example for Google applications; matches Google's custom button components
Any valid CSS selector pattern to match custom clickable elements (e.g., '[data-clickable]', '.interactive-element', '.custom-link')
values.source: src/content_scripts/common/utils.js:246, 247 - Appended to CSS selector list in isElementClickable()

usageContext.description: When entering hints mode with 'f', Surfingkeys generates hints for clickable elements. This setting extends the built-in list of clickable selectors to include custom elements defined by this CSS selector.

notes: The custom selector is appended to the default clickable selectors list. Multiple selectors can be combined using commas. The selector is used in conjunction with: a, button, select, input, textarea, summary, *[onclick], *[contenteditable=true], *.jfk-button, *.goog-flat-menu-button, *[role=button], *[role=link], *[role=menuitem], *[role=option], *[role=switch], *[role=tab], *[role=checkbox], *[role=combobox], *[role=menuitemcheckbox], *[role=menuitemradio]

example.description: Add custom button class to clickable elements
